Here's my theory on what Assembling Contraptions would be, or would have been.  
  
Say Wizards creates a new artifact type called a Contraption. Let's say that Contraptions had the tendency of being a bit overpowered for their cost, boasting abilities that would typically cost around 4-7 mana but only cost like 2 or 3 mana on Contraptions. It would be a broken mechanic... if not for the fact that they aren't Assembled. So all Contraptions would basically have the ability "Contraptions cannot attack or block and activated abilities can't be activated unless a Rigger assembles it". Then each Rigger would have the ability Assemble {X}, where the player would pay X mana to assemble the Contraption (and to make it a little more bearable, we can activate only as a sorcery). So that way, Contraptions would be balanced out and not be overpowered in any way.
